summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Christopher J. Dodd. The documents primarily concern the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) handling of HSCA (House Select Committee on Assassinations) staff payroll records, focusing on the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents include final determination notifications, payroll records, correspondence, fingerprint analysis reports, and requests for information related to HSCA staff and their background checks. The documents also detail the 201 system for identifying and tracking persons of interest.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Christopher J. Dodd has no significance in the JFK context.
